bibl.title: Despatch from William D. McCoy to William F. Wharton, July 19, 1892
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

correspAction.roleName: U.S. Minister Resident and Consul General

div1.p: No. 10. Consulate-General, U. S. A. Monrovia, Liberia, July 19, 1892
Mr. William D. McCoy, to the Department of State.
Report upon the use of electricity as a Power and in the Propagation and Growth of plants.
No. 10. Consulate-General, U. S. A., Monrovia, Liberia, July 19, 1892.
Honorable Assistant Secretary of State, WASHINGTON, D. C.

Sir: In compliance with your Instructions to report upon the use of electricity as a power, and in the propagation and growth of plants, I have to say:-- There is not an electric plant of any description in Liberia.
William D. McCoy, Minister Resident and Consul General
